snippet: The plan covers the New York and Los Angeles metro areas and is expected to expand, and it offers the Postal Service a chance to take profitable business away from rivals.
abstract: Financially-strapped United States Postal Service, which failed to win congressional approval to end Saturday mail delivery, strikes deal with Amazon.com to deliver company's packages on Sundays; plan, first for both, covers New York and Los Angeles metro areas and is expected to expand; move offers Postal Service chance to take profitable business away from rivals.
lead_paragraph: The plan covers the New York and Los Angeles metro areas and is expected to expand, and it offers the Postal Service a chance to take profitable business away from rivals.

headline.main: Postal Service to Make Sunday Deliveries for Amazon
headline.print_headline: Postal Service to Make Sunday Amazon Deliveries
